abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain chess column notes that the biggest obstacle chess players face when they return to competition is reconditioning themselves to the pressure; cites experiences of Gata Kamsky, Yasser Seirawan, Greg Shahade and Alexander Morozevich, who is poised to rejoin world's top 10 rankings.
snippet: The biggest obstacle chess players face when they return to competition is reconditioning themselves to the pressure.
lead_paragraph: The biggest obstacle chess players face when they return to competition is reconditioning themselves to the pressure.

headline.main: Even the World’s Best Players Struggle After a Timeout
headline.seo: Chess: Elite Players Struggle After Taking Break From Play
headline.print_headline: Even the World’s Best Players Struggle After a Timeout
